article.headline: Colgate-Palmolive Co. stock falls Tuesday, still outperforms market
article.body: Shares of Colgate-Palmolive Co. CL, +1.30% slipped 1.12% to $77.54 Tuesday, on what proved to be an all-around dismal trading session for the stock market, with the S&P 500 Index SPX, +0.87% falling 1.40% to 3,360.97 and Dow Jones Industrial Average DJIA, +0.56% falling 1.34% to 27,772.76. The stock's fall snapped a two-day winning streak. Colgate-Palmolive Co. closed $2.56 below its 52-week high ($80.09), which the company achieved on September 3rd. The stock demonstrated a mixed performance when compared to some of its competitors Tuesday, as Procter & Gamble Co. PG, +0.89% rose 0.16% to $139.61, Unilever PLC ADR UL, +1.44% fell 1.92% to $61.73, and Reckitt Benckiser Group PLC RBGPF, +0.93% fell 2.89% to $95.60. Trading volume (2.6 M) remained 545,011 below its 50-day average volume of 3.1 M. Editor's Note: This story was auto-generated by Automated Insights using data from Dow Jones and FactSet. See our market data terms of use.
